sources.title: Strange Fascination (1952) Hugo Haas, Cleo Moore, Mona Barrie
sources.description: Strange Fascination is a 1952 American FILM NOlR directed by Hugo Haas, starring Cleo Moore, himself and Mona Barrie. This was the first of many films pairing Haas and Moore. You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia .

metadata.Plot: Middle-aged European pianist Paul Marvan (Hugo Haas)is brought to America by wealthy widow Diana Fowler (Mona Barrie)and he meets and weds a canary-blonde named Margo (Cleo Moore), who is a nightclub dancing partner to Carlo (Rick Vallin). Margo's trampy and flirty behavior inflames Marvan, who is also disturbed over increasing financial and professional straits, since Diana, his wealthy "sponsor" who was more a little perturbed when Marvan married the little tramp. He thrusts one hand into a printing press in hopes of collecting $50,000 insurance, but payment is refused when it is disclosed his accident wasn't an accident. Margo returns to Carlo, and Marvan finds refuge in a Salvation Army shelter, now playing the piano with one hand.
metadata.Actors: Cleo Moore, Hugo Haas, Mona Barrie
